org.eclipse.keyple.core.seproxy

Interface SeReader

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<SeReader>, Configurable, Nameable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ObservableReader, ProxyReader, SmartInsertionReader, SmartRemovalReader, SmartSelectionReader
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLocalReader, AbstractObservableLocalReader, AbstractReader

    public interface SeReader
extends Nameable, Configurable, java.lang.Comparable<SeReader>
    SeReader interface
    • To retrieve the unique reader name
    • To check the SE presence.
    • To set the communication protocol and the specific reader parameters.
    Interface used by applications processing SE.

    • Method Detail

      • isSePresent

        boolean isSePresent()
             throws KeypleIOReaderException
        Checks if is SE present.
        Returns:
        true if a Secure Element is present in the reader
        Throws:
        KeypleIOReaderException - if error while reading SE

      • addSeProtocolSetting

        void addSeProtocolSetting(SeProtocol seProtocol,
                          java.lang.String protocolRule)
        A protocol setting is an association that establish the link between a protocol identifier and a String that defines how a particular SE may match this protocol.

        For example:

        for a PC/SC plugin the String is defined as a regular expression that will be applied to the ATR in order to identify which type of SE is currently communicating.

        for another plugin (e.g. NFC or proprietary plugin) the String would be any specific word to match a value handled by the low level API of the reader (e.g. "NfcA", "NfcB", "MifareClassic", etc)

        A reader plugin will handle a list of protocol settings in order to target multiple types of SE.

        Parameters:
        seProtocol - the protocol key identifier to be added to the plugin internal list
        protocolRule - a string use to define how to identify the protocol

      • setSeProtocolSetting

        void setSeProtocolSetting(java.util.Map<SeProtocol,java.lang.String> protocolSetting)
        Complete the current setting map with the provided map
        Parameters:
        protocolSetting - the protocol setting map

      • getTransmissionMode

        TransmissionMode getTransmissionMode()
        Returns:
        the transmission mode in use with this SE reader
